Grab your mask, and get ready! It's Phoenix Fire Week! 🔥 During this student orientation week, all students are invited to the school for a one-time in-person relationship-building session to get to know their teachers and classmates before we kick off fully remote learning from home next week. Tomorrow, we welcome our 6th graders to campus for outdoor activities from 9 - 11 AM and our 9th graders from 1 - 3 PM.

To maintain safety:
- Do not come to campus if you are exhibiting symptoms of COVID-19, have been exposed to someone with COVID-19, or have traveled anywhere outside of the "lower-risk" states, as defined by MA, in the past 14 days.
- Wear a mask that covers both the nose and mouth. (Loving our Boston Prep branded masks!!)
- We'll remain outside, six feet apart at all times.

For more information, check out our Phoenix Fire Week website: https://www.bostonprep.org/phoenix-fire-week-2020.

Today, Representative John Lewis will be laid to rest, but his words and spirit remain very much alive. In this essay, penned just before his passing to be published today, the day of his funeral, he speaks directly to our young people.

"Now it is your turn to let freedom ring. When historians pick up their pens to write the story of the 21st century, let them say that it was your generation who laid down the heavy burdens of hate at last and that peace finally triumphed over violence, aggression and war. So I say to you, walk with the wind, brothers and sisters, and let the spirit of peace and the power of everlasting love be your guide."

Ms. Dewey has done just that but continues to find tremendous excitement in her daily work as Boston Prep's College Counselor. "I love that at Boston Prep, acceptance to college is not the end of the road. We know that challenges don’t end at high school graduation, so we continue to support alumni throughout college and beyond. Knowing that students will have the support to help them earn their degree makes my work to help them get into college much more rewarding. This is especially true this time of year when my seniors have recently made their college decisions and the excitement is building for their next chapter!" -Ms. Dewey, College Counselor

Our mission is clear. We are dedicated to ensuring not only college access but college success for all.

We know that on-campus residence is one of the best predictors of college persistence and success among our alumni. We are actively reaching out to all alumni to assess what challenges college closures are presenting for them. Some have already reached out with concerns about access to internet, access to tutoring, and more. In this time of uncertainty, our alumni can be certain that, thanks to the Persistence Project, Boston Prep is here to provide direct support in whatever way they need to ensure their continued success. We cannot allow this public health crisis to become a college persistence crisis.

Alumni, please reach out if your college campus is closing and you are in need of support.
